namespace lua

Enumerations

Type

Enumeration defining core Lua types.  Returned by Object.type.

Values

TYPE_STRING TYPE_NUMBER TYPE_TABLE TYPE_NIL TYPE_BOOLEAN TYPE_FUNCTION TYPE_USERDATA TYPE_LIGHTUSERDATA TYPE_THREAD

Please refer to the Lua documentation for more information.

Variables

Nil

struct Nil {}

An empty structure you don’t usually make instances of, the only (singleton) instance is nil.

nil

static Nil nil

The “nil” value that can be assigned as table member etc.  It represents an instance of an empty struct, basically.

Object

struct Object

This is an object, a container holding a reference to any Lua type.  The type is unreferenced when the destructor is called.

You can also retrieve actual C++ values, the raw Lua state and others using this.

Constructs the object from raw Lua state and the index of the item on the stack.

template<typename T> Object(const T &o)

Constructs the object from an object of any type that contains a method “object” returning Object.

Object

~Object()

Unreferences the held reference.

push

void push() const

Pushes the held object onto the stack.

state

lua_State *state() const

Returns the raw Lua state for the object.

clear

void clear()

Unreferences the held reference and NULLs the state pointer.  Useful to get rid of objects before the end of their lifetime.

type

Type type() const

See lua.Type.  Returns the type of the value held by this object.

type_name

types::String type_name() const

See type.  Returns the type name.

is_nil

bool is_nil() const

Returns true if the object is nil, false otherwise.

to

template<typename T> T to() const

Returns the value of the object converted into the given type.

equals

template<typename T> bool equals(const T &o) const

Checks for value equality with another object.

==

template<typename T> bool operator==(const T &o) const

See equals.

object

const Object& object() const

Returns this.

check_type

inline void check_type(lua_State *L,
int idx,
int expected_type,
const char *expected_name)

Checks the type of the value at the given position on the stack and fails if it isn’t the expected one.  Sends an error to Lua in that case.
